sentence.text: Moebius syndrome (MBS) is a rare congenital disorder characterized by rhombencephalic myelination development, mainly presenting with facial palsy with limited gaze abduction.
Mutant mice for positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II were reported to present with facial weakness, resembling MBS.

entity.text: positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: We screened 95 sporadic patients diagnosed as MBS or HCFP for mutations in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II.

entity.text: positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
